executive_summary: The industry distributes plumbing fixtures, hydronic equipment and other heating and plumbing supplies from manufacturers to professional contractors and other downstream markets. These products are used in the construction, repair and remodeling of residential and nonresidential buildings. This industry relies on downstream demand for construction and renovation work, which have stayed relatively stable, except for a decline in 2020 because of COVID-19, enabling revenue to rebound in 2021 because of a low starting point. Revenue is expected to rise at a CAGR of 2.5% to $91.4 billion over the past five years, including an expected decrease of 0.6% in 2023 alone as pent-up demand is satisfied.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: COVID-19 brought about a unique set of challenges and opportunities for the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry, significantly influencing the industry's source of revenue. With social distancing rules and stay-at-home orders in place, there was an increased focus on home improvements and renovations. This notably boosted the residential construction market, driving up demand for plumbing and heating supplies for home projects. On the other hand, non-residential construction activities saw a noticeable slowdown because of the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Growth in Disposable Income Spurred Demand for High Priced Products
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While the economy was significantly disrupted in 2020 because of COVID-19, it has progressively recovered in the following years. With this, disposable income has experienced growth which has risen consumers' willingness to invest in high-quality plumbing and heating supplies. With an increase in disposable income, individuals and families are more likely to carry out home remodeling or renovation projects, driving up the demand for diverse and quality plumbing and heating supplies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Technological Advancements in Products Fueled Consumer Interest
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The swift pace of technological advancements affects the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry. Modern systems utilizing advanced sensor technology or offering remote control and monitoring features have increasingly been sought after. Consumers are attracted to these products for multiple reasons. These include that they allow for improved, simplified control and operation and they significantly enhance product efficiency and lifespan.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Recovery of Construction Markets Will Support Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, the industry will be supported by a return to growth in both the residential and non-residential construction markets. As economies recover from the effects of COVID-19, and with confidence returning to real estate markets, construction activities will increase, driving demand for plumbing and heating supplies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Wholesalers Will Embrace Digitization to Stay Competitive
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite promising opportunities for revenue expansion presented by recovery in both construction markets, wholesalers will be challenged by the increasingly competitive environment. The rate of revenue growth will be slower than the previous years because of more players vying for a share of the market. Wholesalers have realized the potential of online platforms and the opportunities they offer in reaching a wider audience and providing round-the-clock service. Investment in digital strategies, like e-commerce platforms, digital marketing and customer relationship management systems, will continue to be key strategies in the coming years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Threat of Wholesaler Bypass Will Continue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With the rise of e-commerce, wholesaler bypass has been an increasing threat to the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry. More and more manufacturers and suppliers are selling directly to consumers, eliminating the need for intermediaries. This trend can cut wholesalers out of the supply chain. Despite this rising threat, there are several strategies that wholesalers can adopt to stay relevant and continue contributing to revenue growth. One key approach is to position themselves as indispensable partners rather than just transactional intermediaries.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Merger and Acquisition Activity Will Increase
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As competition intensifies within the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry, the next five years will see increased merger and acquisition (M&A) activity. Larger wholesalers will acquire smaller players to gain a competitive edge by amplifying their product offerings and expanding their geographic reach.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Trend of Smart and Energy-Efficient Technologies Will Continue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, the continued trend towards smart and energy-efficient technologies will contribute significantly to the revenue growth of the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry. The increasing emphasis on eco-friendly living and energy conservation will drive demand for smart, energy-efficient heating and plumbing solutions. Products like smart thermostats that offer automated climate control, sensor-based plumbing systems and energy-efficient water heaters will become increasingly popular among consumers.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry wholesale plumbing supplies (e.g. fixtures and valves), heating equipment (e.g. hot water radiators) and other plumbing and hydronic equipment. Industry operators are not involved in wholesaling gas clothes dryers, electric water heaters, electric stoves, refrigerators or air conditioners. The sales and distribution branches of manufacturers are included in this industry.
key_trends: The Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry has experienced growth over the past five years. Despite a slowdown in 2020 because of COVID-19, wholesalers have benefited from strong construction markets.

Over the next five years, plumbing and heating supplies wholesalers will increase their value-added services to avoid wholesaler bypass. To remain competitive wholesalers will need to highlight their importance in the supply chain.

market_segmentation.segment_description: In this market segment, plumbing and heating equipment is sold to independent contractors that then do remodeling or repair jobs on residential buildings. Demand from this market segment is heavily influenced by consumer spending and trends.

Construction and maintenance work on commercial structures like offices, shopping malls, hotels, warehouses, hospitals and schools are included in this market. Contractors in this sector also complete work in factories and mills that are used in the manufacturing industry.

This market segment includes plumbing and heating supplies that are sold to construction markets for new residential building construction. Demand from this segment is largely related to new housing starts.
This market is made up of all other downstream markets, including retailers, general manufacturing, oil and gas and agriculture companies.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Sump Pumps and Water Treatment Equipment

tier_2_suppliers: Boiler & Heat Exchanger Manufacturing in the US
Heating & Air Conditioning Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Home Improvement Stores in the US
Industrial Building Construction in the US
Heating & Air-Conditioning Contractors in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private residential spending on home improvement is a key downstream market in which industry products are implemented. An aging US housing stock and the desire to spend income on durable goods as opposed to leisure both play into increased home improvement spending in recent years. Declines in private spending on home improvements pose a potential threat to the industry.

The private nonresidential construction market purchases products carried by plumbing and heating supplies wholesalers. Consequently, construction growth drives demand for plumbing supplies and heating equipment. The value of private nonresidential construction was disrupted by COVID-19 because of temporary shutdowns of businesses and social distancing regulations. It is recovering although at a slower rate than expected.

Home renovations, in addition to the desire for expensive houses with multiple bathrooms, are the single-largest downstream market for industry products. When consumers have the confidence in the economy to make value-boosting additions to their homes, industry revenue increases. The consumer confidence index has been volatile over the past five years because of several economic fluctuations.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Price of Plastic Materials and Resin
demand_determinants.determinant_description: A majority of plumbing fixtures are either made from plastic components or are made entirely of various types of plastic. Compared with metal, plastic loses far less heat to the environment and thus reduces costs for the end user. Increases in the price of plastic materials and resin can represent a potential opportunity for the industry if the wholesaler can successfully pass on the price increase to downstream customers.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is the most populated region in the US. Locating in the Southeast places wholesalers in proximity to several major markets. This strategic location can reduce distribution costs, allow quicker delivery times and enhance customer service. The Southeast region has a robust real estate market, which stimulates demand for plumbing and heating supplies. The continuous construction of new homes creates a steady customer base for wholesalers in this industry.

The West is home to a large number of plumbing and heating supplies wholesalers. The region has several metropolitan areas, giving wholesalers who locate there access to large downstream markets. California is the most populated state in the region and in the US. This makes it an attractive location for wholesalers to operate in because there is a high demand for plumbing services and therefore, plumbing and heating supplies.

The business benefits greatly from the abundance of establishments provided by the Mid-Atlantic region, which is home to important urban areas like the Greater New York City area and Philadelphia. There is a need for industrial items in the area because of the climate and population density, especially during the chilly winter months when heating is crucial.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry must adhere to the regulations set by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA). This requires them to ensure a safe and healthy working environment by adhering to guidelines about proper handling of materials or equipment, correct storage practices to avoid accidents and clear communication about potential hazards. Violations of these regulations could lead to penalties, shutdowns or potential legal issues.

Holding a valid wholesale license is a mandatory requirement in the Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry. This license is issued by state or county agencies and permits the holder to buy goods in bulk for resale. The regulations stipulate that businesses conduct good practice, report all

The industry must comply with the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), which sets national standards for wage and hour issues. Under this act, employers must provide minimum wage and overtime pay for workers exceeding 40 hours in a work week. It also provides regulations regarding child labor. Non-compliance with FLSA regulations can lead to fines and lawsuits. These guidelines are designed to ensure fair treatment in the workplace.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline life cycle stage, which increases barriers to entry.
The industry has a low and steady level of assistance, which does not significantly impact barriers.

factors_increased_barrier: The industry is in the decline life cycle stage.
factors_decreased_barrier: The industry has a low level of capital intensity.
The industry has a low level of concentration.
The industry has a low level of technology change.
The industry has a low but increasing level of globalization.

basis_points.basis_description: Wholesale bypass has become an increasing threat because of e-commerce. This has caused price-based competition to grow in importance as a factor of industry performance.
Wholesalers of plumbing and heating products endure competition from manufacturers. Related manufacturers compete with the industry by selling directly to retailers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Diverse range of products leads to market fragmentation
concentration_points.concentration_description: The plumbing and heating supplies wholesaling industry is characterized by dispersing a wide variety of products. This encourages the existence of numerous wholesalers each specializing in different areas, resulting in a fragmented industry.

The plumbing and heating supplies wholesaling industry is seeing an upward trend in consolidation, as larger companies acquire smaller ones to increase market share, reduce costs, and enhance distribution networks.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES ACCOUNT FOR OVER HALF OF REVENUE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Plumbing and heating products are sourced by industry wholesalers from a variety of producers and sellers. Additionally, the purchase of fuel for distribution and delivery vehicles falls under this category.
Wages account for a significant amount of industry revenue. Because wages have risen more quickly than sales, wage costs now make up an increasing percentage of total revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is labor intensive, with wage costs accounting for a large amount of industry revenue. It is key for operators to hire knowledgeable employees to help build a strong reputation.

The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The plumbing supplies segment has a lot of variety
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This section includes water treatment equipment, filtration equipment and well and sump pumps. Toilets, urinals, bidets, sinks, bathtubs and showers are examples of plumbing fixtures.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: PLUMBING EQUIPMENT COMES IN MANY DIFFERENT MATERIALS
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: A wide variety of plumbing equipment made of plastic, copper, iron or ceramics is included in this section of products.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: THERE'S A DEMAND FOR HIGH-END HYDRONICS SYSTEMS
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Demand for high-end Hydronics systems from the nonresidential remodeling market has caused these sectors' percentage of industry revenue to slightly increase and this trend is likely to continue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: THE INDUSTRY DISTRIBUTES A LARGE RANGE OF PRODUCTS
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In addition to bathroom cabinets, faucet handles, soap holders and other sanitary bathroom supplies, industrial wholesalers also sell sanitary goods, such as bath screens and other kinds of shower enclosures.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Trends in Construction Markets Affects Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The Plumbing and Heating Supplies Wholesaling industry is highly dependent on construction activity. With increases in housing starts and commercial builds, the demand for plumbing and heating supplies increases. Conversely, a slowdown in construction can significantly reduce demand.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in Technology and Economic Conditions Affect Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Rapid innovations in product technology can significantly influence industry volatility. The introduction of energy-efficient or smart heating systems, for example, may cause demand spikes for these specific products while.

FAQs.question: How does your company maintain a competitive edge in such a crowded industry?
FAQs.answer: Certain industry operators have begun to market their own private labels. Industry operators are also offering same-day delivery, extended warranties and customization.

FAQs.question: Are your sales heavily dependent on any one market, major customer or other isolated revenue stream?
FAQs.answer: Industry sales are primarily dependent on the residential and nonresidential remodeling and construction markets.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored growth opportunities via mergers or acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: Industry consolidation through acquisitions has been impacting the industry. Major players have been acquiring many smaller operators to further increase their market share.

FAQs.question: How does the location of your company affect its profitability and growth potential?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators with more distance from their competitors tend to have larger profit margins and grow faster than smaller wholesale companies compared to other industries.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs through technological change past five years?
FAQs.answer: The adoption of radio-frequency identification (RFID) technology has resulted in a reduction in dependence on labor to manage warehousing and distribution.

FAQs.question: How does your company use new technology, such as RFID tags, in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Many industry operators have adopted RFID technology to assist in stocking and maintaining inventory.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly influenced profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The industry does not have a high level of regulation and as such it has not impacted revenue.

FAQs.question: How have you adjusted to new regulations over the past decade? How have you handled compliance costs? Have social distancing policies impacted your company's profitability?
FAQs.answer: Regulations impacting the industry have by and large remained the same during the past decade. In addition, compliance costs are typically nominal. Due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, Industry operators are subject to social distancing restrictions which vary from state to state.

FAQs.question: How frequently have you renegotiated contracts with your suppliers, especially those that are not in your favor?
FAQs.answer: As purchase prices from manufacturers are the single largest cost for nearly all operators, focusing on lowering this cost can have a disproportionately positive impact on profit.

FAQs.question: How often does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: The industry is characterized by a low level of capital intensity, as such new equipment does not play a significant role and does not need to be replaced often.

FAQs.question: How do you cultivate brand relationships? Can you enact any exclusive distribution agreements for suppliers in your area?
FAQs.answer: Ability to stock products with strong brand power. Wholesalers must stock a variety of popular and brand name products by establishing good relationships with brand name manufacturers to compete successfully in this industry.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company to suppliers? How can you strengthen these relationships? How have you maintained your supply chain through the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Having strong links and contracts with suppliers. Wholesalers with multiple suppliers for the same product can provide a wider range of products to customers, ensure that stock is always accessible and potentially lower costs through negotiations.

FAQs.question: What products and services do you offer? Do you poll customers to learn what new products they'd like to see most?
FAQs.answer: Provision of a related range of products and services. Providing a wide range of plumbing and heating equipment from a broad range of different suppliers is key to the success of industry participants and helps reduce the threat of wholesale bypass.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of trends in residential construction? Has demand from new residential construction improved amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic?
FAQs.answer: The residential construction market purchases products carried by plumbing and heating supplies wholesalers. The number of housing starts increased amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic due to increasing per capita disposable income, low-interest rates and low housing stock.

FAQs.question: In which industries do your clients primarily operate? How can you bolster your relationships with nonresidential contractors?
FAQs.answer: The private nonresidential construction market purchases products carried by plumbing and heating supplies wholesalers. Consequently, construction growth drives demand for plumbing supplies and heating equipment.

FAQs.question: How much of your demand is driven by new housing contractors? Do you offer discounts on bulk, full-house orders? Has volatile nonresidential construction amid the pandemic disrupted your operations?
FAQs.answer: New housing construction drives demand for industry products. An increase in the number of houses being built bolsters demand for plumbing and heating equipment. The value of nonresidential construction has declined sharply amid the coronavirus pandemic.
